title: McLeod Glacier (Wilson Hills)
text: McLeod Glacier () is a <a href="glacier">glacier</a> that descends from the <a href="Wilson%20Hills">Wilson Hills</a> of Antarctica, between <a href="Stanwix%20Ridge">Stanwix Ridge</a> and <a href="Arthurson%20Ridge">Arthurson Ridge</a>, into <a href="Davies%20Bay">Davies Bay</a>. It was plotted by Australian cartographers from air photos taken by U.S. Navy <a href="Operation%20Highjump">Operation Highjump</a>, 1946–47, and was named by the <a href="Antarctic%20Names%20Committee%20of%20Australia">Antarctic Names Committee of Australia</a> for geologist <a href="Ian%20R.%20McLeod">Ian R. McLeod</a>, leader of an airborne field party that visited this area with the <a href="Australian%20National%20Antarctic%20Research%20Expedition">Australian National Antarctic Research Expedition</a> ("<a href="Magga%20Dan">Magga Dan</a>") in 1961.
